alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Franklin; Washington (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 22 at 12:31PM CST until February 22 at 1:15PM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM CST FOR CRAWFORD...WESTERN WASHINGTON AND SOUTHWESTERN FRANKLIN COUNTIES... At 1231 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles west of Sullivan to near Leasburg to near Cherryville, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Bourbon, Sullivan, Anthonies Mill, Miramiguoa Park, Courtois, St. Clair and Parkway. This also includes Onondaga Cave State Park, Dillard Mill Historic Site, and Meramec State Park. This includes Interstate 44 in Missouri between exits 210 and 240. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for southeastern and east central Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage.
